SEARCH
Package LDtk

Class TileInstance

java.lang.Object
LDtk.TileInstance
public class TileInstance extends Object
This structure represents a single tile from a given Tileset.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TileInstance()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    getA()
    Alpha/opacity of the tile (0-1, defaults to 1)
    long[]
    getD()
    Internal data used by the editor.
    For auto-layer tiles: `[ruleId, coordId]`.
    For tile-layer tiles: `[coordId]`.
    long
    getF()
    "Flip bits", a 2-bits integer to represent the mirror transformations of the tile.
    - Bit 0 = X flip
    - Bit 1 = Y flip
    Examples: f=0 (no flip), f=1 (X flip only), f=2 (Y flip only), f=3 (both flips)
    long[]
    getPx()
    Pixel coordinates of the tile in the **layer** (`[x,y]` format).
    long[]
    getSrc()
    Pixel coordinates of the tile in the **tileset** (`[x,y]` format)
    long
    getT()
    The *Tile ID* in the corresponding tileset.
    void
    setA(double value)
     
    void
    setD(long[] value)
     
    void
    setF(long value)
     
    void
    setPx(long[] value)
     
    void
    setSrc(long[] value)
     
    void
    setT(long value)

      For auto-layer tiles: `[ruleId, coordId]`.
      For tile-layer tiles: `[coordId]`.

    • getF

      public long getF()
      "Flip bits", a 2-bits integer to represent the mirror transformations of the tile.
      - Bit 0 = X flip
      - Bit 1 = Y flip
      Examples: f=0 (no flip), f=1 (X flip only), f=2 (Y flip only), f=3 (both flips)

    • setF

      public void setF(long value)

    • getPx

      public long[] getPx()
      Pixel coordinates of the tile in the **layer** (`[x,y]` format). Don't forget optional layer offsets, if they exist!

    • setPx

      public void setPx(long[] value)

    • getSrc

      public long[] getSrc()
      Pixel coordinates of the tile in the **tileset** (`[x,y]` format)

    • setSrc

      public long getT()
      The *Tile ID* in the corresponding tileset.
